DOC.brief_summary: This study design test hypotheses incentive increase participation smoke cessation treatment result cessation rate , offer Medicaid BadgerCare Plus pregnant smoker .
DOC.detailed_description: Aim 1 : To determine extent contingent financial `` treatment incentive '' ( i.e. , incentives biochemical verification visit , treatment engagement , abstinence ) versus `` attendance incentive '' ( i.e. , incentive attend biochemical verification visit ) , increase rate prenatal postnatal smoking abstinence . Participants BadgerCare Plus member recruit First Breath program pregnant . Aim 2 : To determine extent treatment incentive , versus attendance incentive , increase rate engagement First Breath smoke cessation intervention offer pregnant postpartum BadgerCare Plus member . Aim 3 : To determine cost‚Äêeffectiveness reach First Breath intervention deliver pregnant postpartum smoker pair treatment incentive pair attendance incentive . Aim 4 : To determine First Breath intervention treatment incentive , comparison intervention attendance incentive , produce significantly great benefit pregnant postpartum woman regard nonsmoking health outcome : i.e. , reduce depression , increased level breast feeding , great perceive support . Aim 5 : To identify moderate mediate effect treatment incentive offer context First Breath intervention deliver pregnant postpartum woman .
DOC.criteria: pregnant woman enrollment Wisconsin Medicaid ( BadgerCare Plus Medicaid SSI ) reside study area member participate Medicaid HMOs involve stop smoking research study 18 old English speaking smoke daily ( least one cigarette day least one week ) time within last 6 month willingness quit smoking , cut , stay quit willing complete study visit phone call willing provide update contact information enrol Wisconsin Medicaid ( BadgerCare Plus Medicaid SSI ) enrol study area member participate Medicaid HMOs pregnant enrol First Breath le 18 year age nonEnglish speak smoke daily ( least one cigarette day least one week ) least time within last 6 month willing complete study procedure assessment provide update contact information
